dt: {bc}a small tablet (as of wood, bone, or ivory) used by the ancient Romans as a ticket, tally, voucher, or means of identification
{bc}a small piece (as of marble, glass, or tile) used in mosaic work

et: Latin, probably ultimately from Greek {it}tessares{/it} four; from its having four corners {ma}{mat|four|}{/ma}
shortdef: a small tablet (as of wood, bone, or ivory) used by the ancient Romans as a ticket, tally, voucher, or means of identification
a small piece (as of marble, glass, or tile) used in mosaic work
